chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zirrus M McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
5 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim: Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Tremblay in a non-professional capacity.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Anger management.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zirrus M McGee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 669
cf

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment. 

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim: Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Tremblay in a non-professional capacity.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Complete 50 hours of community service.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Anger management.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Count 1:  Obstructing an Officer, contrary to sec. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), Wis. Stats.  a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  
James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in contest posture; jury trial requested.  Dates selected with the parties.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel needs additional discovery and requests new date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs additional discovery and requests new scheduling date.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs additional discovery.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
For reasons stated one the record, Commissioner GRANTED the State's motion to REMOVE Justice Point as a condition of bail. Case adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zirrus M McGee in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Zirrus M McGee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
